an2.64:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.64:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.64:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ pabbajitasukhan”ti.
an2.64:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of renunciates.”

an2.65:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.65:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.65:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ nekkhammasukhan”ti.
an2.65:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of renunciation.”

an2.66:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.66:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.66:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ nirupadhisukhan”ti.
an2.66:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of no attachments.”

an2.67:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.67:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.67:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ anāsavasukhan”ti.
an2.67:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of no defilements.”

an2.68:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.68:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.68:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ nirāmisaṁ sukhan”ti.
an2.68:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness not of the flesh.”

an2.69:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.69:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.69:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ ariyasukhan”ti.
an2.69:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is noble happiness.”

an2.70:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.70:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.70:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ cetasikaṁ sukhan”ti.
an2.70:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is mental happiness.”

an2.71:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.71:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.71:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ nippītikaṁ sukhan”ti.
an2.71:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness free of rapture.”

an2.72:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.72:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.72:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ upekkhāsukhan”ti.
an2.72:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness with equanimity.”

an2.73:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.73:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.73:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ samādhisukhan”ti.
an2.73:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is the happiness of immersion.”

an2.74:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.74:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.74:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ nippītikārammaṇaṁ sukhan”ti.
an2.74:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on freedom from rapture.”

an2.75:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.75:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.75:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ upekkhārammaṇaṁ sukhan”ti.
an2.75:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on equanimity.”

an2.76:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of happiness.

an2.76:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of happiness.

an2.76:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sukhānaṁ yadidaṁ arūpārammaṇaṁ sukhan”ti.
an2.76:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of happiness is happiness that relies on the formless.”

an2.151:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of welcome.

an2.151:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of welcome.

an2.151:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ santhārānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammasanthāro”ti.
an2.151:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of welcome is the welcome in the teaching.”

an2.152:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of hospitality.

an2.152:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of hospitality.

an2.152:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ paṭisanthārānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammapaṭisanthāro”ti.
an2.152:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of hospitality is hospitality in the teaching.”

an2.155:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of seeking.

an2.155:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of seeking.

an2.155:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ pariyeṭṭhīnaṁ yadidaṁ dhammapariyeṭṭhī”ti.
an2.155:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of seeking is seeking for the teaching.”

an2.156:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of worship.

an2.156:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of worship.

an2.156:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ pūjānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammapūjā”ti.
an2.156:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of worship is worship of the teaching.”

an2.159:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of growth.

an2.159:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of growth.

an2.159:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ vuddhīnaṁ yadidaṁ dhammavuddhī”ti.
an2.159:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of growth is growth in the teaching.”

an2.161:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of accumulation.

an2.161:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of accumulation.

an2.161:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sannicayānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammasannicayo”ti.
an2.161:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of accumulation is the accumulation of the teaching.”

an2.162:1.1.en: “There are, mendicants, these two kinds of increase.

an2.162:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of increase.

an2.162:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ vepullānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammavepullan”ti.
an2.162:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of increase is increase in the teaching.”

dn21:2.3.3.en: “Lord of gods, there are two kinds of happiness, I say:

dn21:2.3.5.en: There are two kinds of sadness, I say:

dn21:2.3.7.en: There are two kinds of equanimity, I say:

dn21:2.3.9.pli: Somanassampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi, asevitabbampīti iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ, kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
dn21:2.3.9.en: Why did I say that there are two kinds of happiness?

dn21:2.3.15.pli: Somanassampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi, asevitabbampīti.
dn21:2.3.15.en: That’s why I said there are two kinds of happiness.

dn21:2.3.17.pli: Domanassampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi, asevitabbampīti iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ, kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
dn21:2.3.17.en: Why did I say that there are two kinds of sadness?

dn21:2.3.23.pli: Domanassampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi, asevitabbampīti
dn21:2.3.23.en: That’s why I said there are two kinds of sadness.

dn21:2.3.25.pli: Upekkhampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi, asevitabbampīti iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ, kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
dn21:2.3.25.en: Why did I say that there are two kinds of equanimity?

dn21:2.3.31.pli: Upekkhampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi, asevitabbampīti
dn21:2.3.31.en: That’s why I said there are two kinds of equanimity.

dn21:2.4.3.en: “Lord of gods, I say that there are two kinds of bodily behavior:

dn21:2.4.5.en: I say that there are two kinds of verbal behavior:

dn21:2.4.7.en: There are two kinds of search, I say:

dn21:2.4.9.pli: Kāyasamācārampāhaṁ, devānaminda, duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbampi asevitabbampīti iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ, kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
dn21:2.4.9.en: Why did I say that there are two kinds of bodily behavior?

dn21:2.4.14.en: That’s why I said there are two kinds of bodily behavior.

dn21:2.4.17.en: Why did I say that there are two kinds of verbal behavior?

dn21:2.4.21.en: That’s why I said there are two kinds of verbal behavior.

dn21:2.4.24.en: Why did I say that there are two kinds of search?

dn21:2.4.28.en: That’s why I said there are two kinds of search.

dn21:2.5.5.en: There are two kinds of sound known by the ear …

an2.144:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of charity.

an2.144:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of charity.

an2.144:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ pariccāgānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammapariccāgo”ti.
an2.144:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of charity is a charity in the teaching.”

an2.146:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of enjoyment.

an2.146:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of enjoyment.

an2.146:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ sambhogānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammasambhogo”ti.
an2.146:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of enjoyment is the enjoyment of the teaching.”

an2.147:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of sharing.

an2.147:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of sharing.

an2.147:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ saṁvibhāgānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammasaṁvibhāgo”ti.
an2.147:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of sharing is sharing the teaching.”

an2.148:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of inclusion.

an2.148:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of inclusion.

an2.148:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ saṅgahānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammasaṅgaho”ti.
an2.148:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of inclusion is inclusion in the teaching.”

an2.149:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of support.

an2.149:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of support.

an2.149:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ anuggahānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammānuggaho”ti.
an2.149:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of support is support in the teaching.”

an2.150:1.1.en: “There are these two kinds of sympathy.

an2.150:1.4.en: These are the two kinds of sympathy.

an2.150:1.5.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ anukampānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammānukampā”ti.
an2.150:1.5.en: The better of these two kinds of sympathy is sympathy in the teaching.”

mn127:14.4.pli: yvāyaṁ bhikkhu yāvatā ekaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ ‘mahaggatan’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati, yo cāyaṁ bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā rukkhamūlāni ‘mahaggatan’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati—
mn127:14.4.en: Which of these two kinds of mental development is more expansive: when a mendicant meditates focused on pervading as expansive the extent of a single tree root, or two or three tree roots?”

mn127:14.9.pli: yvāyaṁ bhikkhu yāvatā dve vā tīṇi vā rukkhamūlāni ‘mahaggatan’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati, yo cāyaṁ bhikkhu yāvatā ekaṁ gāmakkhettaṁ ‘mahaggatan’ti pharitvā adhimuccitvā viharati—
mn127:14.9.en: Which of these two kinds of mental development is more expansive: when a mendicant meditates focused on pervading as expansive the extent of two or three tree roots, or a single village district …
